hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Transition on Volume Spike Failure
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes, if BTC experiences a volume spike (>2x 20-day average) on a down day (close < open) that fails to recover above the opening price within 48 hours, and the Cumulative Volume Delta turns negative, the market will transition to BEAR regime within 5 days with >68% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: High-volume selling during neutral periods that cannot be absorbed indicates distribution. The failure to recover suggests weak buying interest, often preceding organized downtrends and bear regime initiation.
entry_conditions: Price fails to recover above that day's open within 48 hours

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC reclaims and holds above the volume spike day's high
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 trading days after the 48-hour failure confirmation

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of such signals see immediate reversal and transition to BULL instead, or remain in NEUTRAL.
